subject: How to run a parametrized Junit test in Eclipse
msgSnippet: I am using Junit 4.1 with new style of writing Tests using @Test annotations etc. I have written following class -- EmployeeTest to Test Employee class.
messageBody:
I am using Junit 4.1 with new style of writing Tests using @Test
annotations etc.

I have written following class --> EmployeeTest to Test Employee
class.

Following is the portion of EmployeeTest.java -->

import org.junit.Test;
import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
import org.junit.runners.Parameterized;
import org.junit.runners.Parameterized.Parameters;
import org.junit.Assert;
import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.After;
import org.junit.Ignore;

import org.junit.runner.Result;

import java.util.LinkedList;
import java.util.Iterator;

public class EmployeeTest
{
private Employee satendra;
private Employee pradeep;
private Employee sriram;
String testName;
private Result res;

@Before
public void setUp()
{
res = new Result();
satendra = new Employee("Satendra
Diwedi",30,50000,null);
pradeep = new Employee("Pradeep
Yadav",26,30000,satendra);
sriram = new Employee("Sriram
Sethumadhavan",26,35000,satendra);
}

@Test
public void getName()
{
testName = "getName";
Assert.assertEquals("Satendra
Diwedi",satendra.getName());
Assert.assertEquals("Pradeep Yadav",pradeep.getName
());
}
}

Now my problem is that this class - EmployeeTest has not inherited
TestCase class. As such Eclipse doesn't recognize it as a JUnit
Test. It says --> "No Test Found" when I try it running as a Junit
Test.

What the solution to this problem?

From Command Line run using --> java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore
EmployeeTest - it runs fine.

Regards,

Pradeep
